name: targets
description: A target is an ip address/hostname with a port that identifies an instance of a backend service. Every upstream can have many targets, and the targets can be dynamically added. Changes are effectuated on the fly.

fields.name: target
fields.help: The target address (ip or hostname) and port. If the hostname resolves to an SRV record, the port value will be overridden by the value from the DNS record.

fields.name: weight
fields.help: The weight this target gets within the upstream loadbalancer (0-1000). If the hostname resolves to an SRV record, the weight value will be overridden by the value from the DNS record. Defaults to 100.
